verses.verse: O that <WH4310> <WH5414> thou wast as my brother, <WH251> that sucked <WH3243> the breasts <WH7699> of my mother! <WH517> when I should find <WH4672> thee without, <WH2351> I would kiss <WH5401> thee; yea, <WH1571> I should not <WH3808> be despised. <WH936>

I would lead <WH5090> thee, and bring <WH935> thee into <WH413> my mother's <WH517> house, <WH1004> who would instruct <WH3925> me: I would cause thee to drink <WH8248> of spiced <WH7544> wine <WH4480> <WH3196> of the juice <WH4480> <WH6071> of my pomegranate. <WH7416>
His left hand <WH8040> should be under <WH8478> my head, <WH7218> and his right hand <WH3225> should embrace <WH2263> me.

I charge <WH7650> you, O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> that <WH4100> ye stir not up, <WH5782> nor <WH4100> awake <WH5782> <WH853> my love, <WH160> until <WH5704> he please. <WH7945> <WH2654>

Who <WH4310> is this <WH2063> that cometh up <WH5927> from <WH4480> the wilderness, <WH4057> leaning <WH7514> upon <WH5921> her beloved? <WH1730> I raised thee up <WH5782> under <WH8478> the apple tree: <WH8598> there <WH8033> thy mother <WH517> brought thee forth: <WH2254> there <WH8033> she brought thee forth <WH2254> that bore <WH3205> thee.

Set <WH7760> me as a seal <WH2368> upon <WH5921> thine heart, <WH3820> as a seal <WH2368> upon <WH5921> thine arm: <WH2220> for <WH3588> love <WH160> is strong <WH5794> as death; <WH4194> jealousy <WH7068> is cruel <WH7186> as the grave: <WH7585> the coals <WH7565> thereof are coals <WH7565> of fire, <WH784> which hath a most vehement flame. <WH7957>

Many <WH7227> waters <WH4325> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> <WH853> quench <WH3518> love, <WH160> neither <WH3808> can the floods <WH5104> drown <WH7857> it: if <WH518> a man <WH376> would give <WH5414> <WH853> all <WH3605> the substance <WH1952> of his house <WH1004> for love, <WH160> it would utterly be contemned. <WH936> <WH936>

We have a little <WH6996> sister, <WH269> and she hath no <WH369> breasts: <WH7699> what <WH4100> shall we do <WH6213> for our sister <WH269> in the day <WH3117> when she shall be spoken for? <WH7945> <WH1696>

If <WH518> she <WH1931> be a wall, <WH2346> we will build <WH1129> upon <WH5921> her a palace <WH2918> of silver: <WH3701> and if <WH518> she <WH1931> be a door, <WH1817> we will enclose <WH6696> <WH5921> her with boards <WH3871> of cedar. <WH730>
I <WH589> am a wall, <WH2346> and my breasts <WH7699> like towers: <WH4026> then <WH227> was <WH1961> I in his eyes <WH5869> as one that found <WH4672> favor. <WH7965>

Solomon <WH8010> had <WH1961> a vineyard <WH3754> at Baal-hamon; <WH1174> he let out <WH5414> <WH853> the vineyard <WH3754> unto keepers; <WH5201> every one <WH376> for the fruit <WH6529> thereof was to bring <WH935> a thousand <WH505> pieces of silver. <WH3701>

My vineyard, <WH3754> which is mine, <WH7945> is before <WH6440> me: thou, O Solomon, <WH8010> must have a thousand, <WH505> and those that keep <WH5201> <WH853> the fruit <WH6529> thereof two hundred. <WH3967>
Thou that dwellest <WH3427> in the gardens, <WH1588> the companions <WH2270> hearken <WH7181> to thy voice: <WH6963> cause me to hear <WH8085> it.
Make haste, <WH1272> my beloved, <WH1730> and be thou like <WH1819> to a roe <WH6643> or <WH176> to a young <WH6082> hart <WH354> upon <WH5921> the mountains <WH2022> of spices. <WH1314>
